QuestionStatement: During a mild recession, if policymakers want to reduce unemployment by increasing investment, which of the following policies would be most appropriate?
AnswerChoices: Equal increases in government expenditure and taxes
An increase in government expenditure only
An increase in the reserve requirement
Purchase of government securities by the Federal Reserve

QuestionStatement: Which of the following monetary and fiscal policy combinations would most likely result in a decrease in aggregate demand?
Which of the following is true of supply shocks?
AnswerChoices: They tend to change both relative prices and the general price level in the economy
They affect only the general price level
They can be anticipated and offset with appropriate fiscal policy
They can be anticipated and offset with appropriate monetary policy
They make the aggregate supply curve vertical

QuestionStatement: Suppose that, from 1985 to 1986, unemployment fell from 7.2 to 7.0 percent and inflation fell from 3.8 to 1.1 percent.  An explanation of these changes might be that the
AnswerChoices: Aggregate demand curve shifted to the left
Aggregate demand curve shifted to the right
Aggregate supply curve shifted to the left
Aggregate supply curve shifted to the right
Short-run Phillips curve shifted to the right

QuestionStatement: If higher United States interest rates cause foreign demand for the dollar to increase, which of the following will occur to the international value of the dollar and to United States exports?

The table below indicates the number of labor hours required in Countries X and Y to produce one unit of food or one unit of clothing.CountryFoodClothingX20 hours50 hoursY10 hours20 hoursGiven this information, which of the following statements is correct?
AnswerChoices: X has a comparative advantage in the production of both food and clothing
Y has a comparative advantage in the production of both food and clothing
X has a comparative advantage in food production whereas Y has a comparative advantage in clothing production
Y has a comparative advantage in food production, whereas X has a comparative advantage in clothing production
Neither country has a comparative advantage in the production of either good

QuestionStatement: Which of the following groups of people would benefit from unanticipated inflation?I.      SaversII.      BorrowersIII.      Lenders
An increase in the labor force participation rate will
AnswerChoices: Make it easier to reduce unemployment
Make it more difficult to reduce unemployment

QuestionStatement: Which of the following is a key feature of Keynesian economics?
AnswerChoices: The level of saving depends mostly on interest rates
The level of government expenditure depends mostly on interest rates
Macroeconomic equilibrium can occur at less than full employment
Wages are more flexible than prices

QuestionStatement: If a large increase in total spending has no effect on real gross domestic product, it must be true that
AnswerChoices: The economy is experiencing high unemployment
The spending multiplier is equal to 1
The economy is in short-run equilibrium

QuestionStatement: According to Keynesian theory, the most important determinant of saving and consumption is the
Under which of the following circumstances would increasing the money supply be most effective in increasing real gross domestic product?

Faced with a large federal budget deficit, the government decides to decrease expenditures and tax revenues by the same amount.  This action will affect output and interest rates in which of the following ways?
If crowding out only partially offsets the effects of a tax cut, which of the following changes in interest rates and gross domestic product are most likely to occur?
All of the following are components of the money supply in the United States EXCEPT

The graph above depicts an economy’s aggregate demand and aggregate supply curves.  If aggregate demand remains constant, the equilibrium price levels in the short run and in the long run will be which of the following?
According to both monetarists and Keynesians, which of the following happens when the Federal Reserve reduces the discount rate?
AnswerChoices: The demand for money decreases and market interest rates decrease
The demand for money increases and market interest rates increase
The supply of money increases and market interest rates decrease
The supply of money increases and market interest rates increase
Both the demand for money and the supply of money increase and market interest rates increase

QuestionStatement: An increase in which of the following is most likely to increase the long-run growth rate of an economy’s real per capita income?
AnswerChoices: The proportion of gross domestic product consumed
The educational attainment of the population
The supply of money in circulation

QuestionStatement: An increase in the money supply will have the greatest effect on real gross domestic product if
AnswerChoices: The marginal propensity to consume is low
Investment spending is not sensitive to changes in interest rates
The quantity of money demanded is not very sensitive to interest rates
The required reserve ratio is high

QuestionStatement: If the Federal Reserve undertakes a policy to reduce interest rates, international capital flows will be affected in which of the following ways?
AnswerChoices: Long-run capital outflows from the United States will decrease
Long-run capital inflows to the United States will increase
Short-run capital outflows from the United States will decrease
Short-run capital inflows to the United States will decrease
Short-run capital inflows to the United States will not change
